document.docAuthor: Webb, Donald W. & Metz, Mark A.
document.masterDocTitle: A Revision of the New World Genera Brachylinga Irwin and Lyneborg and Lysilinga Irwin and Lyneborg (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) with the Description of a New Genus, Elcaribe Webb

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A Revision of the New World Genera Brachylinga Irwin and Lyneborg and Lysilinga Irwin and Lyneborg (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) with the Description of a New Genus, Elcaribe Webb

subSubSection.paragraph:
Niger
(Latin) = black. This name is used as an adjective and refers to the black coloration of the specimens.

Lysilinga nigra
is taxonomically associated with
L. chamela
and
L. digita
in lacking setae on the katepisternum; in having the abdomen dark reddish brown; in having the halter knob dark brown; lacking dorsocentral macrosetae; and the hypoproct quadrate ( Fig. 366 ).
Lysilinga nigra
differs from
L. chamela
and
L. digita
in having the male frons setose; the anterior half of the ejaculatory apodeme cylindrical (Fig. 436); and the female abdomen dark reddish brown, glossy, pruinescence white on the posterolateral area of tergites 1–7.

Head. Length 0.84 mm . Ommatidia smaller ventrally and laterally. Frons pruinescence silver gray, black dorsally with pair of small black areas dorsal to antennal base; setae dark reddish brown intermixed with dark yellow setae. Antenna/head length 0.69; scape and pedicel dark reddish brown, pruinescence gray, flagellum dark brown with apical third of first flagellomere dark yellow; scape length 0.22 mm , width 0.12 mm , length/width 1.8, scape/pedicel length 3.7, scape/flagellum width 0.75, setae dark reddish brown; pedicel length 0.06 mm , length/width 0.5; first flagellomere almost spherical, apical fourth attenuate apically, flagellum length 0.30 mm , width 0.20 mm , length/width 1.9, flagellum/scape length 1.4. Parafacial dark reddish brown, pruinescence gray. Maxillary palpus dark yellow; length 0.36 mm , length/width 5.1; setae dark yellow. Genal setae white. Occipital setae white becoming pale yellow, lanceolate, appressed along margin of eyes dorsally. Postocular macrosetae dark reddish brown.

Thorax. Macrosetae dark reddish brown, 3 np, 2 sa, 1 pa, 0 dc, sc 1. Mesonotum dull brown; setae white, elongate intermixed with pale violet, lanceolate, appressed, polychromatic setae. Pleuron dark reddish brown, pruinescence gray; setae white on propleuron, anepisternum, laterotergite, and metanepisternum, pale violet, lanceolate, appressed, polychromatic on scutellum, absent on katepisternum. Wing. Membrane pale brown becoming darker apically; veins brown; length 4.8 mm , length/width 2.8; pterostigma brown; cell m 3 open widely. Halter dark brown. Legs. Coxal macrosetae dark reddish brown. Femora dark yellowish brown; ventral setae white on fore­ and midfemur; av 1:0:3, pv 0:0:5. Tibiae dark yellow to pale brown. Tarsi dark yellowish brown.
Head. Frontal setae dark reddish brown intermixed with dark yellow setae (MEI 050596, 103376).
Thorax. Macrosetae 3 np, 1–2 sa, 1 pa, 0 dc, 1–2 sc. Wing. Membrane dark yellow (MEI 103376). Legs. Femora dark yellow (MEI 050596, 103376); av 1:0:3–4, pv 0:0:4–7.
Similar to male except for following.

Head. Frons black, pruinescence gray, whitish gray ventrally with pair of small, dark brown areas dorsal to antennal base; setae dark reddish brown. Antenna dark brown to black, scape and pedicel pruinescence gray. Occipital setae white, elongate becoming reddish brown, lanceolate, slightly iridescent, appressed dorsally.

Thorax. Macrosetae 3 np, 2 sa, 1 pa, 0 dc, 1–2 sc. Mesonotal setae dark brown, short intermixed with white and turquoise, lanceolate, iridescent, appressed setae (on some specimens these setae appear pale violet). Legs. Femora dark yellow, dorsoapical area grading into reddish brown to dark brown; av 1–2:0:2–5, pv 0:0:2–7.

Abdomen. Dark reddish brown, glossy, pruinescence white on posterolateral area of tergites 1–7; dorsal setae dark reddish brown, appressed with white, elongate, appressed setae across posterior margin of tergites 1–3; lateral setae dark reddish brown.
Terminalia
(MEI 101492). Anterior margin of sternite 8 slightly convex. Furca ( Fig. 444 ) oblong; length 0.35 mm , width 0.25 mm ; posteromedial lobe large cone­shaped; anterolateral and anteromedial projections absent. Common spermathecal duct ( Fig. 444 ) shorter than furca. Spermathecal duct directed anteriorly, sac­like posteriorly then becoming thread­like anteriorly.

Distribution Lysilinga nigra
is known from Mexico ( Fig. 449 ).

Adults of
Lysilinga nigra
have been handnetted and collected in Malaise traps from 12 February to 3 July.

Type specimen . The holotype male of
Lysilinga nigra Webb
(MEI 101362) is labeled " MEXICO , Jalisco , Careyes, 12 Feb–19 Mar 1997 , F. D. Parker" and is deposited in the USNM.
